item.title: #126 Chris Grosso
item.itunes:title: #126 Chris Grosso
item.description:
Author Chris Grosso joins me to discuss addiction, depression, the importance of being real with yourself, and his new book Dead Set On Living. In this new work, Chris collaborates with Ram Dass, Tara Brach, Noah Levine, Gabor Mate, Duncan Trussell, Sharon Salzberg and others. Together, they offer reasons why people return to self-defeating behaviors and how they can heal.

★★★★★ Please take a moment to rate the show on iTunes. It helps bring more guests you’d like to hear. Go to your app, click on the show, and scroll down to rate. Thanks!

Come say hello on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter.

item.title: To Meat or Not To Meat?
item.itunes:title: To Meat or Not To Meat?
item.description:
The ethical decision whether to eat meat or not in modern society is complex if you have your thinking hat on. In this mini-hustle, I answer a listener question about my trip to vegetarianism and back.

I was a strict vegetarian for seven years, and I got back on the meat eating train about four years ago.  Recently, I've been thinking about the issue and feeling resistant to eating meat. In this episode, I chew on (ha ha) factory farming, human biology, the food cycle in the natural world, food commerce, and why self-imposed dietary labels are tricky. 

★★★★★ Please take a moment to rate the show on iTunes. It helps bring more guests you’d like to hear. Go to your app, click on the show, and scroll down to rate. Thanks!

Come say hello on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.

item.title: Meditation AMA Part 2 / What is Normal?
item.itunes:title: Meditation AMA Part 2 / What is Normal?
item.description:
I recently released an episode called Meditation AMA Part 1 in which I answered listener questions about meditation. The episode had a healthy response and everyone wanted more. So, here is Part 2 where I address the following:

• Can I meditate less since I’ve started feeling the benefits in my daily life?

• How do you get yourself in the mindset to meditate?

• When and where should I meditate?

This episode comes with an important bonus question. It was submitted as a meditation question, but ended up being much larger and turning into its own mini-hustle. The question was:

• How do we make decisions based on the cultural representation of normal?

This is something every self-aware human critter struggles with. I had a great time unpacking it and feel that I gave a valuable take on it.

★★★★★ Please take a moment to rate the show on iTunes. It helps spread the hustle and bring more guests you’d like to hear.

Go to your app, click "more episodes" and scroll down to rate. Thanks. I appreciate you.

Come say hello on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.

item.title: Everything and Nothing
item.itunes:title: Everything and Nothing
item.description:
How can a person be everything and nothing at the same time? In this mini-hustle I answer a listener question about being. Along the way I discuss individuality, how each of us are unique, radical honesty, and why it's important to share our experiences.

item.itunes:title: Meditation AMA Part 1
item.description:
I recently sent an email to my mailing list which asked listeners to submit their questions about meditation. This episode is the first part of an occasional series in which I answer several listener questions at a time. I discuss the following in this inaugural episode:

• Do I need a meditation teacher?

• Is there a correct or incorrect way to meditate?

• What would I share with people in an hour long class?

item.title: Do Objective Truths Exist?
item.itunes:title: Do Objective Truths Exist?
item.description:
Can what we experience point to truths beyond our perception? In this mini-hustle I answer a listener question by discussing the following topics:

• Subjective observation of the material world.

• The definition of truth.

• The evolutionary reason for increasingly peaceful societies.

• Trustable things can we learn about the universe from our human point of view.

This podcast is sponsored by ONNIT. Get a free bottle of Alpha Brain for a limited time and 10% off your order by going to https://www.onnit.com/hustle.

item.description:

item.title: Why Should People Care?
item.itunes:title: Why Should People Care?
item.description:
If our lives are temporary moments of awareness that end in oblivion, why should we care about others and how much? I answer this listener question and address ideas of meaning, intuition and human reciprocity.

I’m honored to be able to share ideas with you. If any of my solo podcasts or interviews have been useful to you in a way that makes you feel inclined to contribute to my operational costs, you can do that here: http://www.cory-allen.com/support

You can also help spread the world of the hustle by dropping me a ★★★★★ review on iTunes. Go to your app, click on ‘more episodes’ and scroll al the way down to give us a rating.

Come say hello on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.
item.content:encoded:
If our lives are temporary moments of awareness that end in oblivion, why should we care about others and how much? I answer this listener question and address ideas of meaning, intuition and human reciprocity.

I’m honored to be able to share ideas with you. If any of my solo podcasts or interviews have been useful to you in a way that makes you feel inclined to contribute to my operational costs, you can do that here: http://www.cory-allen.com/support

You can also help spread the world of the hustle by dropping me a ★★★★★ review on iTunes. Go to your app, click on ‘more episodes’ and scroll al the way down to give us a rating.

Come say hello on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.

item.title: Friends of Friends
item.itunes:title: Friends of Friends
item.description:
Our culture constantly hits us with an idealized version of friendship. It suggests how many friends we should have, how often we should talk to them, and why those bonds are important. This leaves people feeling like something is wrong with them if they don’t have their own sitcom to live in. On this mini-hustle, I talk about the reality of friendships and why quality is better than quantity.  

Hey friend, come say what’s up on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.

★★★★★ Please take a minute to rate The Astral Hustle with 5 stars on iTunes. It helps the podcast grow and brings the guests you want to hear.

item.title: New Year Real You
item.description:
I'm not with the term ‘New Year New You.’ I feel it’s a part of the cultural lexicon that  suggests you aren’t good enough and that you should keep trading your money for corporate products and your attention for social influence all based on the the vampiric illusion of macro-tribal inclusion. It also makes us second guess our intuition. That keeps us feeling incomplete, which keeps us yearning, which keeps us stuck.

Not in 2018 my friends! In the final mini-hustle of 2017, I suggest embracing the term ‘New Year Real You’ as a reminder to listen to our intuition, follow our compass, pop the shackles of the illusion, and let out the whole you. You don’t need a ’new you.’ The actual you is awesome. Trust and love them. Fear of believing in yourself is just another symptom of living in a culture that’s set on making you feel inadequate. Let the real you out to play in 2018 and finger paint on the black and white walls of normalcy.

Come share some love with me on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter and so forth, and so on, and what have you.

★★★★★ Please take a minute to rate The Astral Hustle with 5 stars on iTunes. It helps the podcast grow and brings the guests you want to hear.

item.title: #17 Consciousness Cryptomnesia
item.description:
In this episode of the Astral Hustle, Cory talks about waking up and realizing your consciousness oozed out of your body during the night. He then talks about flow state as a form of enlightenment and subjective perception being like bad movie computer graphics. Finally, Cory answers a listener question about deja vu in which he suggests our sense of 'I' is nothing more than a wicked case of cryptomnesia. 

The intro/outro music is The Gash by The Flaming Lips

item.title: #16 Andrew M. McKenzie [The Hafler Trio]
item.description:
On this episode of The Astral Hustle, I'm joined for a conversation about all things esoteric by Andrew McKenzie, a Scottish born hypnotist, psychotherapist, teacher, lecturer and artist. In his conceptual art as The Hafler Trio, Andrew has collaborated with artists such as Jonsi Birgisson (Sigur Ros), Michael Gira (Swans), Blixa Bargeld (Einstürzende Neubauten), Current 93, Nurse With Wound, Genesis P-Orridge, Autechre, Jóhann Jóhannsson and many others. 

Check out Andrew at http://simplysuperior.org

A few of his lectures: 
https://vimeo.com/131277740
https://vimeo.com/130013319
 https://vimeo.com/131396552

The intro/outro music is Huit Octobre 1971 by Cortex

- -

item.description:
On this special episode of The Astral Hustle, Cory announces that the binaural beats project he has been working on with Aubrey Marcus is here!

Cory then takes us through a detailed description of what binaural beats are, the unique process and approach he used to create these, and a track by track explanation of what's going on under the hood. 

You can check out the full project at our binaural beats page.

item.title: #14 Jon Mueller
item.description:
In this episode of The Astral Hustle, I’m joined by masterful drummer and percussionist Jon Mueller (Death Blues, Volcano Choir). We start off by talking about Jon’s work and some of the hard questions one encounters while traveling the creative path. We then move to talking about the act of living, what it could mean to be human, how and why humans resist and deal with death, and how to get out of the patterns of our daily lives in order to stay open.

Check out Jon’s art and music at http://rhythmplex.com
Follow him on twitter at @jonmueller

 The intro music is Consonance by Death Blues
The outro music is A Magnetic Center by Jon Mueller

 - - 

Thanks to Guayaki Yerba Mate for supporting this episode.
cory-allen.com/theastralhustle

item.title: #13 John F. Simon Jr
item.description:
In this episode of The Astral Hustle its my great pleasure to join in conversation with my friend John F Simon Jr. He is a visual artist and author with works in MoMA, Guggenheim, Whitney, SF MoMA, LA MoA, and countless others. He also collaborated with Bjork on her Biophilia app. 

John is an artistic buddha, with a deep understanding of the creative process, what it means to be an artist, and how that connects with meditation and mindfulness. 

We talk about when we first met, the artistic path, and the many layers of the inward journey. 

Check John's work out at numeral.com and his daily improv drawings at iclock.com

This episode is fueled by Cuvée Coffee from Austin. The Fazenda Pantano and Black and Blue Nitro are my daily favorites. 

The intro/outro music is Guinnevere from the Complete Bitches Brew Sessions by Miles Davis

cory-allen.com/theastralhustle

item.title: #5 Daniele Bolelli
item.description:
The great Daniele Bolelli, writer, philosopher, martial artist, and drunken taoist, joins me on The Astral Hustle. We talk about the origin of consciousness and spirituality without bullshit. Check him out at danielebolelli.com and @dbolelli

This episode is sponsored by Punctum Records. 
punctumrecords.com

The intro/outro music is Nètsanèt by Mulatu Astatke. 
https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/netsanet-liberty/id78928362?i=78928311

item.title: #4 Speaking From the Heart-Mind
item.description:
In this episode, Cory talks about altering the tone of your perception, speaking from the Heart-Mind, trusting your intuition, honoring your most authentic self, and merging with cosmic oneness.  

Intro/Outro music is 'Requiem Pour Un Con' by Serge Gainsbourg

https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/requiem-pour-con-bof-le-pacha/id182281339?i=182281397

item.title: #3 Let's Dilate Our Energetic Receptacles
item.description:
In this episode of The Astral Hustle, Cory talks about chilling out so you can dilate your energetic receptacles, how your consciousness is a map of the universe, a person's atomic electromagnetic field being neutralized and more. The episode wraps with a guided visualization on how to get out of your body and observe your mind. 

 

Intro/Outro song is 'Everybody Loves the Sunshine' by Roy Ayers.
https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/everybody-loves-the-sunshine/id51296?i=51284

item.title: #2 Answers To Unanswerable Philosophical Questions
item.description:
In this episode of The Astral Hustle, Cory answers eight unanswerable philosophical questions impromptu. Why is there something instead of nothing? What are numbers?

Cory answers these questions and suggests that someone should be eaten by a lion and a shark at the same time. 

Intro/Outro music is 'Na Na Na Yeh Kya Karne Lage Ho' by Kalyanji - Anandji
https://itunes.apple.com/ca/album/the-bombay-connection/id344959452

item.title: #1 Spirit Sculptures Going Into Black Holes
item.description:
In the first episode of 'The Astral Hustle', Cory introduces the podcast and talks about our spirits being sculptures, which leave our bodies, and attach to a larger sculpture in the cosmos. This massive sculpture made of trillions of spirits then rips through a black hole and into a fractal of space time. 

Intro/Outro music is 'Que Beleza' by Tim Maia. 
https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/world-psychedelic-classics/id548525301
